programme.title: World's Greatest: Capital Cities
programme.desc: With visionaries, politicians, and activists, these metropolises are defined as the official seats of government. Dublin, Washington, and Taipei share broad avenues, museums, and monuments, but are as varied as the countries they represent.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Deserts
programme.desc: For all their reputation as inhospitable places, deserts are full of incredible plants and animals that have adapted to the climate. They are bursting with geological wonders that inspire and are home to some of the most life in the world.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Iconic Buildings
programme.desc: In construction, only a few buildings can be groundbreaking. Vastly different in shape, size, and function, these diverse buildings prove there is no recipe for greatness, just the fundamental ingredients of vision, bravery, and imagination.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Wetland Animals
programme.desc: Wetland Animals dives into the swamps, rivers, and flood plains of the Everglades, Botswanaâ€™s Okavango Delta, Kakadu National Park in Australia, and the Amazon to see deadly crocodiles, piranhas, hippopotamus, flamingo, manatee, and platypus.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Coasts
programme.desc: Along coasts, one element ends and another begins. No two days are ever the same on a coastline: the only thing that remains a constant is the timeless power of the sea.

programme.title: Arthur: To Tibble the Truth/Waiting to Go
programme.desc: When the Tibble Twins' constant lying lands them in constant trouble, they promise to tell only the truth. Binky and Brain collide on the soccer field, breaking Brain's new watch and nearly breaking their friendship.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's Pet Business/D.W. The Copycat
programme.desc: How can Arthur prove to his parents that he's responsible enough to take care of his very own puppy? "Get a job," suggests D.W.!. Yet another personality change for D.W., who's decided that from now on, she'll be just like Arthur.

programme.title: Arthur: Popular Girls/Buster's Growing Grudge
programme.desc: Sue Ellen and Fern take a popularity quiz in a magazine and change their personalities to become more likable, but it backfires. And Buster's convinced that his great joke will be the difference between a successful oral report and failure.

programme.title: Arthur: Prunella's Special Edition/The Secret Life Of Dogs & Babies
programme.desc: The latest book about everyone's favorite boy wizard--Henry Skreever--is finally out! Every kid in town is lining up to get it, except Prunella, who's ordered a limited edition from England. Ever wonder what Baby Kate and Pal are thinking?

programme.title: Arthur: War of the Worms/I Owe You One
programme.desc: Brain is always taking the fun out of Fern's storytelling by correcting her facts, but things gets out of hand when Fern tricks him with a fake story! Buster is always asking for favors. Will he learn the real meaning of friendship?

programme.title: Arthur: Binky Goes Nuts/Breezy Listening Blues
programme.desc: When Binky discovers that he's allergic to peanuts, he has so many questions, but learns that the best way not to go nuts is to be well informed and to understand his allergy. Much to his horror, Brain gets a "B-" on a test.

programme.title: Arthur: Sue Ellen Gets Her Goose Cooked/Best of The Nest
programme.desc: Sue Ellen is the champion of the popular Internet game, Virtualgoose.com, but sheâ€™s become obsessed! And now the gang has moved onto Best of the Nest. Will any of his friends be willing to forgo their computers for a real, live adventure?

programme.title: Arthur: Prunella the Packrat/What's in a Name?
programme.desc: Prunella saves everything. Can Arthur help her break her packrat habits in time to put together the display for the school's Earth Day fair? Binky find out that his real name isn't Binky--it's Shelley?!

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur The Wrecker/Arthur and The True Francine
programme.desc: Arthur always seems to wreck things, and this time it's Mom's computer. Can he get it fixed before Mom finds out? Then, Muffy A. Crosswire and Francine are absolute best friends, despite their rather obvious differences.

programme.title: Rommel: The Soldier, The Son, and Hitler
programme.desc: Never a member of the Nazi party, Rommel detested blending politics and war. He would quickly discover that both were always in play under Hitler.

programme.title: D-Day: Secret Raids That Won The War
programme.desc: Examining the RAF 617 squadron and their history of operations throughout the war.

programme.title: Boy Soldiers Of World War II
programme.desc: In Britain during World War Two, thousands of men over the age of 18 were conscripted into the army, but among them were hundreds of underage boys, some as young as 15, who lied about their age so that they could join up.

programme.title: VE Day - Forever in their Debt
programme.desc: Tells the stories of those who experienced the end of the war in all its many forms. It features a wide range of interviews from children who remember the street parties, to the servicemen who remember not having to buy a single drink that day.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine: Building The Brand
programme.desc: Hitlerâ€™s fascination with propaganda was born in the trenches of the First World War. There he saw it emerge as a potent tool of psychological warfare - one that he would harness to build the Nazi movement. Witness Hitler's early propaganda tactics.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: John & Kelsey
programme.desc: John is ready to leave Detroit but one thing holds him back: Kelsey. The two have never spoken outside of online chats but John is sure she's the one. Can he include Kelsey in his plans? (S3, ep6)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Chitara & Priscilla
programme.desc: Chitara took a big leap and came out to her family when she met Priscilla online, but Priscilla ended their relationship unexpectedly. Now Chitara is determined to find out what happened.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Paris enlists Nev and Max to help her figure out who has been catfishing her for the past four years. But as the guys investigate, they make a shocking discovery. (S5, ep11)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: After months of intimate texts with Titus, a man she met online, Candice has decided to tell to her husband. But before she does, she asks Nev to help her find out who Titus really is! (S5, ep16)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Felipe & Jasmine
programme.desc: Single father Felipe is ready to settle down with Jasmine. However, the two have been talking online for eight months and have never met. Max returns and joins Nev to investigate.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Kailani has fallen for Sam, her gay friend's online ex-boyfriend. Sam claims to love Kailani, but has been acting strange since she has tried to meet up with him. Nev and Max investigate. (S6, ep9)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Blues, Balls, & Brawls
programme.desc: Jenni plans a surprise birthday party for Roger that goes south, Deena auditions Danny to be a meatball and the roommates find themselves in the middle of a brawl at the club. (S6, ep4)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Merp Walk
programme.desc: Jenni learns the extent of her injury. Mike considers taking things with Paula to the next level. Deena holds Meatball Auditions and ends up rolling out of the sauce pan and into the fire. (S6, ep5)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Let's Make it Official
programme.desc: Jenni wonders where she stands with Roger and realises they might be in more trouble than she thought. Mike decides it is time for him to take his relationship with Paula to the next level. (S6, ep6)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Great Meatballs of Fire
programme.desc: Mike adjusts to being in a relationship and gets confused about the rules. Deena goes back to her meatball ways, but has to fight for her right to party. (S6, ep7)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Control the Crazy
programme.desc: Sammi confronts Deena about her meatball antics and the two of them go head-to-head. Mike and the roommates get to know Paula's wild side, and Mike isn't sure he can handle it. (S6, ep8)

programme.title: 48 Hours: Fatal Choice
programme.desc: In August 2009, Sandra Franklin called police to report a confrontation with her husband, Dr. Peter Franklin. Shortly after, authorities received a call from Peter, who had been stabbed. Within hours, Peter was dead and Sandra was charged with murder.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Murder by Design
programme.desc: Investigators question whether designer Gianni Versace was the random victim of a killing spree, or he knew the man who shot him to death.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Driven to Extremes
programme.desc: Authorities investigate a case of love, infidelity, road rage and possible murder in Texas.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Killer Next Door
programme.desc: Donald Miller, was sentenced to 30 to 50 years for rape and attempted murder but was suspected in four other murders. In an unusual plea bargain, Miller agreed to work with police trying to recover his memories of other murders.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Mortician, The Murder, The Movie
programme.desc: When an elderly millionaire is found dead in a freezer, her decades-younger companion is brought up on murder charges; the movie inspired by the story, \Bernie.\

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Box O' Fun/U.S Acres: Unidentified Flying Orson/School Daze
programme.desc: Garfield plays in an empty cardboard box./Orson's science fiction book inspires Roy to play a trick./Jon sends Garfield to a school for cats run by an ex-Marine.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Scared to Death

programme.title: 48 Hours: Why Did Josh Kill?

programme.title: 48 Hours: Temptation in Texas
programme.desc: A report about the 2011 shooting death of Greg Williams, and the question of whether he was killed with his own gun by an intruder inside his suburban Dallas home - as his wife Michele Williams has claimed - or if Michele herself was guilty of the crime.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Killing Fields
programme.desc: A report about a desolate strip of land between Houston and Galveston where over 30 young women and girls have disappeared or have been murdered.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Stranger You Know

programme.title: Twin Peaks

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: The next morning, Cooper meets with Audrey, who confesses to leaving him the note about One Eyed Jacks. Cooper tells Truman he can't remember who the killer was in his dream, but insists the dream is a code to solving the crime.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Cooper questions Dr. Jacoby, who suspects Leo Johnson is the killer. Cooper's supervisor, Gordon Cole, calls in with Albert's report. Josie Packard spies on Ben Horne and Catherine Martell. Hawk tracks down the One Armed Man.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Cooper and company have tea with the Log Lady. The Log Lady tells them there was a third man following after Leo and Jacques the night Laura died. At Jacques Renault's cabin Cooper, Hawk, and Truman find Waldo the bird.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Audrey cons her way into working at the perfume counter where Laura worked. She discovers that it's being used as a recruitment post for One Eyed Jacks. James, Donna and Maddy plan to lure Jacoby away from his office.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Audrey is hired at One Eyed Jacks, but is caught in a trap when her father arrives. Cooper gets Jacques Renault to reveal the details of Laura's last night in the cabin. Deputy Andy saves Truman's life and apprehends Renault.
